problem: What is the tens digit of $5^{2005}$?
solution: Note that for $n\geq 2$, the last two digits of $5^n$ are 25.  To prove this, note that $5^2\equiv 25 \pmod{100}$, and whenever $5^{n-1}\equiv 25\pmod{100}$, we also have $5^n=5\cdot 5^{n-1}\equiv 5\cdot 25 \equiv 125 \equiv 25 \pmod{100}$. Thus the tens digit of $5^{2005}$ is $\boxed{2}$.
